meanings.definition: (verb) to protrude through an abnormal opening
meanings.sent1: The disc in his back started to herniate, causing him pain.
meanings.sent2: If the pressure is too high, the tire might herniate and burst.
meanings.sent3: The overstuffed suitcase decided to herniate its contents at the worst possible moment.
meanings.sent4: The truth began to herniate through the layers of deception.
meanings.sent5: The balloon animal artist twisted the balloon until it began to herniate into a new shape.

meanings.sent1: The herniate patient needed surgery to repair the hernia.
meanings.sent2: She felt self-conscious about her herniate condition at the gym.
meanings.sent3: The herniate cat seemed to move more carefully than usual.
meanings.sent4: The herniate wall of the building was a cause for concern.
meanings.sent5: The herniate backpack was too heavy for him to carry comfortably.

meanings.definition: (noun) a protrusion of an organ or tissue through an abnormal opening
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed him with a herniate in his abdomen.
meanings.sent2: The herniate was causing discomfort and needed immediate attention.
meanings.sent3: The herniate in the fence allowed the curious dog to escape.
meanings.sent4: The herniate in the fabric created a unique pattern on the dress.
meanings.sent5: The herniate of the tree roots made the path uneven and tricky to walk on.
